title: After Iranian attack on its territory, Israel says it is 'ready for all scenarios'
summary: On Saturday night, Tehran fired more than 300 drones, cruise missiles and ballistic missiles at Israel, an unprecedented operation and a sign of concerning escalation. Washington is trying to persuade Israel not to retaliate.

title: UN chief warns that 'Now is the time to defuse,' Iran's envoy says Tehran 'had no choice'
summary: Israel is calling for sanctions against Tehran. Late on Saturday, Iran launched a direct attack on Israel for the first time.

title: Germany continues to prefer rapprochement to confrontation with China
summary: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is expected in Beijing on Sunday for a visit intended to celebrate the economic ties between the two countries – a far cry from the promises of strategic change made by Berlin in recent months.

title: Inflation in France: Crowdfunding comes to the rescue of struggling people
summary: Some affected by setbacks, worsened by the increasing cost of living, are resorting to online crowdfunding to get by.

title: In New York, Donald Trump faces historic rendez-vous with justice
summary: The first criminal trial of a former US president, which opens in Manhattan on April 15, will play a decisive role in the race for the White House. Up to now, the Republican candidate has used his indictments to his political advantage.

title: 'I'll get back to you ASAP!!!': How the exclamation point infected work messaging
summary: The most trivial conversation on a professional communication platform now displays exclamation marks left and right, mirroring their use in text messages. The result runs from overplayed enthusiasm to toxic positivity.

title: NBA: Thunder grab top seed in West, Lakers one win from playoffs
summary: The unexpected Oklahoma City Thunder clinched the Western Conference top seed. In New Orleans, superstar LeBron James scored 28 points with 11 rebounds and 17 assists in his 112th career triple-double over the Pelicans and eighth place in the West.

title: In the heart of Copenhagen's Christiania neighborhood, the 'Pusher Street' drug dealers are being forced out
summary: Tired of clashes between gangs vying to control the drug market, the residents of the libertarian enclave of Christiania have made the cobbled street where the dealers used to operate impassable.

title: Our selection of household objects that are as stylish as they are environmentally friendly
summary: From a perpetual calendar to a herbal tea lollipop to a Japanese pot, these items are made with sustainable materials in ethical conditions and come at reasonable prices.

title: Polish parliament takes step toward legalizing abortion
summary: Four bills aimed at legalizing abortion rights in the country, one of the most restrictive in Europe, have passed their first reading. It is a first in almost 30 years.

title: To ban or not to ban TikTok, an American dilemma
summary: For the US House of Representatives, which wants to shut it down or 'nationalize' it, the Chinese platform is a threat to American democracy. But its popularity with users puts Biden, just as it had Trump, in a difficult position.

title: Australian man who killed six suffered from mental illness, with 'no evidence' of ideological motivation
summary: Six passers-by were stabbed to death in a shopping mall in Sydney on Saturday. The murderer was shot by a policewoman.

title: Survivors of the suicide attack at Ariana Grande's concert in 2017 sue intelligence agency
summary: A suicide bomber set up a knapsack bomb in Manchester Arena, in northwestern England, at the end of the concert on May 22, 2017, killing 22 and injuring over 100 people, many of them children and teenagers.

title: In Paris, tour guides show the city through the history of minorities
summary: Eager to bring the history of minorities into the spotlight, several guides are showing the Paris of the Black or LGBT+ communities and offering a fresh, inclusive look at the capital.

title: How Taiwan became a leader of the bicycle industry
summary: While TSMC's semiconductor factories dominate, the cycling giants Giant and Merida, along with their subcontractors, serve as the island's second economic powerhouse.

title: 'Academics would do well to speak out before it's too late'
summary: In 2006, one in two people lived in a zone of academic freedom. Today, the figure is one in three. University budgets are shrinking and it has become difficult to discuss sensitive issues. Le Monde spoke to Katrin Kinzelbach, a specialist in international human rights policy and initiator of the annual Academic Freedom Index.

title: Paris 2024: Olympic track is going purple for the first time
summary: The rubber used for the athletic tracks is in a new color and uses a new generation of granules that are more elastic and cohesive, reducing energy loss and possibly improving performance.

title: Journalism and Crisis: Join Le Monde in English for a special event in New York!
summary: Le Monde's English edition crosses the Atlantic from April 15-17 for a series of events in New York City, free and open to the public.

title: Australian political staffer found to have committed rape in parliament
summary: The civil verdict on a 2021 case of rape, committed by Australian conservative staffer Bruce Lehrmann on his colleague Brittany Higgins in the office of a government minister in 2019, comes as a dramatic development in a scandal which rocked Australian politics.

title: Macron calls for Israel to 'avoid escalation' but says Iran's attack was 'disproportionate'
summary: In a televised interview, Emmanuel Macron also said that French planes had helped defend Jordan's air space during the Iranian attack on Israel.

title: Macron reveals Plan B if security risk too high for Paris Olympics opening ceremony on Seine
summary: The French president announced on Monday the July 26 ceremony could move to either the Trocadéro or the Stade de France in the case of a security threat.

title: Israel and Iran: After a shadow war, the peril of direct confrontation
summary: Israel's strategy has changed since October 7, and is now focusing on revenge. Tehran's regime, which until now had avoided any direct confrontation with Israel, has intentionally crossed a historic threshold in launching its attack.

title: France hosts conference on aid to war-torn Sudan
summary: The conference, held on the first anniversary of Sudan's civil war, features representatives from its neighbors, Gulf states and western powers, all brought together to collect donations for an underfunded UN humanitarian aid appeal.

title: Singapore's prime minister announces resignation
summary: Lee Hsien Loong will relinquish his office to his deputy Lawrence Wong on May 15.

title: Philippine's Marcos refuses to hand Duterte to ICC
summary: Thousands of people have been killed in the anti-narcotics campaign started by former president Rodrigo Duterte in 2016 and under investigated by the International Criminal Court.

title: Retaliation or de-escalation? Israel's dilemma after Iran's attack
summary: Part of Benjamin Netanyahu's government wants to fight back at all costs, despite warnings from the US, which fears a regional conflagration.

title: At the heart of Trump's criminal trial, a system of hush money set up before the 2016 election
summary: Accused of falsifying accounting documents, the Republican candidate tried to conceal an affair with the porn star Stormy Daniels during his first presidential campaign.
